results.description: Chemotherapy is a type of cancer treatment that uses drugs to kill cancer cells. Learn how chemotherapy works against cancer, why it causes side effects, and how it is used with other cancer treatments.
results.title: Chemotherapy to Treat Cancer - National Cancer Institute

results.description: A study conducted primarily in mice suggests that pre-surgical chemotherapy in breast cancer can cause changes in cells in and around the tumor that aid metastasis.
results.title: Unrecognized Effect of Chemotherapy Uncovered - National Cancer Institute

results.description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog about a nanoparticle that mimics Salmonella and may help counteract chemotherapy resistance.
results.title: Nanoparticle Counteracts Chemotherapy Resistance - National Cancer Institute

results.description: Bone loss associated with chemotherapy appears to be induced by cells that stop dividing but do not die, a recent study in mice suggests. The researchers found that two investigational drugs could block signals from these senescent cells and reverse bone loss in mice.
results.title: A Strategy for Preserving Bone During Chemotherapy - National Cancer Institute

results.description: Prior to the 1950s, treatment for the majority of cancers was limited to either surgery or the use of radiation. The discovery of the use of methotrexate in curing a rare cancer marked the first time a cancer had been cured. This led to the development of many of today’s common cancer treatments.
results.title: Discovery – Methotrexate: Chemotherapy Treatment for Cancer - National Cancer Institute

results.description: A laboratory study has revealed an entirely unexpected process for acquiring drug resistance that bypasses the need to re-establish DNA damage repair in breast cancers that have mutant BRCA1 or BRCA2 genes.
results.title: New principle of chemotherapy resistance - National Cancer Institute

results.description: Covers side effects that patients may have during chemotherapy and ways to manage them.
results.title: Chemotherapy and You: Support for People With Cancer - National Cancer Institute

results.description: The FDA has approved rolapitant to prevent chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting.
results.title: Preventing Nausea and Vomiting from Chemotherapy - National Cancer Institute

results.description: A Cancer Currents blog on a study which showed a shorter chemotherapy course following surgery may be preferred for some patients with colon cancer.
results.title: Less Adjuvant Chemotherapy for Colon Cancer - National Cancer Institute

results.description: Strategy looks to slow or prevent metastatic breast cancer by targeting hidden, dormant cancer cells.
results.title: Sensitizing Dormant Tumor Cells to Chemotherapy - National Cancer Institute
